bibl.title: The Demoticity of Latest Late Egyptian.
Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008.

bibl.note: Presents observations about what it means that latest Late Egyptian (c. 1000 BCE) already looks in some respects like Demotic (from c. 650 BCE). - Is latest Late Egyptian a separate stage of Egyptian? - A demoticism in latest Late Egyptian: js (from jw ns) 'of' in Papyrus Reinhardt. - js 'of' in latest Late Egyptian and the history of genitive 'of' in Late Egyptian, Demotic, and Coptic.
bibl.seg: Leo Depuydt, The Demoticity of Latest Late Egyptian.

Mark Depauw & Yanne Broux (edd.), Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 231 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 27-42, 1 tabl.

Presents observations about what it means that latest Late Egyptian (c. 1000 BCE) already looks in some respects like Demotic (from c. 650 BCE). - Is latest Late Egyptian a separate stage of Egyptian? - A demoticism in latest Late Egyptian: js (from jw ns) 'of' in Papyrus Reinhardt. - js 'of' in latest Late Egyptian and the history of genitive 'of' in Late Egyptian, Demotic, and Coptic.
